snippet: Senator Ron Wyden has urged the Justice Department to reopen its investigation into the agency over its improper search of computer files of the Senate Intelligence Committee.
abstract: Pres Obama publicly expresses his confidence in John O Brennan, director of the Central Intelligence Agency, despite Brennan's admission that the agency improperly searched computer files of the Senate Intelligence Committee; Sen Ron Wyden, an Oregon Democrat who sits on the panel, wants Justice Department to reconsider whether criminal charges should be pursued under laws prohibiting computer hacking.

byline.original: By CARL HULSE and MARK MAZZETTI

lead_paragraph: Senator Ron Wyden has urged the Justice Department to reopen its investigation into the agency over its improper search of computer files of the Senate Intelligence Committee.

headline.main: Obama Expresses Confidence in C.I.A. Director
headline.print_headline: Obama Expresses Confidence in C.I.A. Director
